title: NASA Optical Navigation Tech Could Streamline Planetary Exploration
summary: In a dim, barren landscape like the surface of the Moon, it can be easy to get lost. With few discernable landmarks to navigate with the naked eye, astronauts and rovers must rely on other means to plot a course. As NASA pursues its Moon to Mars missions, encompassing exploration of the lunar surface and […]

title: Carving Canyons
summary: Erosion, tectonic uplift, and a human-built dam have all helped shape the Upper Lake Powell area in Utah. This astronaut photograph was acquired on July 28, 2023, with a Nikon D5 digital camera using a focal length of 1,150 millimeters. It is provided by the ISS Crew Earth Observations Facility and the Earth Science and […]

title: ISS prepares for Starliner contingencies and resumption of EVAs
summary: The last month has been an eventful one for the Expedition 71 crew on the International Space Station and their two helpers from the Starliner Crew Flight Test (CFT). It is still not known when – or even if – CFT will return to Earth with crewmembers Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, two veteran astronauts and test pilots that have been in space well beyond the initial duration of eight days envisaged when they launched into orbit on June 5.

title: PLD Space to start building French Guiana launch facilities next month
summary: As Arianespace ramps up following Ariane 6’s July maiden flight from Europe’s spaceport in French Guiana, a Spanish venture is preparing to become the first non-institutional launcher to reach orbit from the base next year.

title: Long-term moon mission safety depends on sturdy infrastructure
summary: GOLDEN, Colorado — A future where the moon serves as a long-term haven for human explorers is within reach but significant challenges like constructing launch and landing facilities, addressing moonquakes, […]

title: Heavier smallsats weigh down market forecasts
summary: The number of smallsats forecasted to launch in the next decade is declining as some satellites get heavier.

title: Live coverage: NASA to discuss ISS schedule shuffle amid SpaceX Crew-9 launch delay, Boeing Starliner questions
summary: The media briefing comes a day after formally pushing the launch of the SpaceX Crew-9 mission to the International Space Station from mid-August to late-September. The teleconference is slated to begin at 12:30 p.m. EDT (1630 UTC).

title: Firefly signs multi-launch agreement with L3Harris
summary: Firefly Aerospace has won a contract from L3Harris for as many as 20 launches of its Alpha rocket over five years.

title: Little Place Labs and Loft Orbital to test analytics in orbit
